abstract: <jats:p>This study provides a comprehensive overview of the genus <jats:italic>Zygota</jats:italic> Förster combining DNA barcoding and current morphology. Nineteen species of <jats:italic>Zygota</jats:italic> were found throughout Germany, including the newly described species <jats:italic>Zygota walli</jats:italic><jats:bold>sp. nov.</jats:bold> First species records for Germany are: <jats:italic>Zygota balteata</jats:italic> Macek, 1997; <jats:italic>Z. comitans</jats:italic> Macek, 1997; <jats:italic>Z. spinosipes</jats:italic> (Kieffer, 1908); <jats:italic>Z. sordida</jats:italic> Macek, 1997; <jats:italic>Z. angularis</jats:italic> Macek, 1997 and <jats:italic>Z. vigil</jats:italic> Nixon, 1957. We also clarify diagnoses for the two related genera, <jats:italic>Pantoclis</jats:italic> Förster and <jats:italic>Zygota</jats:italic> to designate the boundaries of the <jats:italic>Zygota</jats:italic> genus and propose new synonymies: <jats:italic>Zygota caligula</jats:italic> Buhl, 1997 is a junior synonym of <jats:italic>Z. congener</jats:italic> (Zetterstedt, 1840); <jats:italic>Z. reticulata</jats:italic> Kozlov, 1978 is a junior synonym of <jats:italic>Z. ruficornis</jats:italic> (Curtis, 1831). Thirteen species of <jats:italic>Zygota</jats:italic> sensu Nixon (1957) are transferred to the genus <jats:italic>Pantoclis</jats:italic> with the following new combinations proposed: <jats:italic>Zygota brevinervis</jats:italic> (Kieffer, 1908) (= <jats:italic>Pantoclis brevinervis</jats:italic> (Kieffer, 1909), <jats:bold>comb. nov.</jats:bold>); <jats:italic>Z. brevipennis</jats:italic> (Kieffer, 1908) (= <jats:italic>P. brevipennis</jats:italic> (Kieffer, 1908), <jats:bold>comb. nov</jats:bold>.); <jats:italic>Z. caecutiens</jats:italic> (Kieffer, 1908) (= <jats:italic>P. caecutiens</jats:italic> (Kieffer, 1908), <jats:bold>comb. nov.</jats:bold>); <jats:italic>Z. cursor</jats:italic> (Kieffer, 1908) (= <jats:italic>P. cursor</jats:italic> (Kieffer, 1908), <jats:bold>comb. nov.</jats:bold>); <jats:italic>Z. fossulata</jats:italic> (Thomson, 1858) (=<jats:italic>P. fossulata</jats:italic> (Thomson, 1858), <jats:bold>comb. nov.</jats:bold>); <jats:italic>Z. fuscata</jats:italic> (Thomson, 1858) (= <jats:italic>P. fuscata</jats:italic> (Thomson, 1858), <jats:bold>comb. no</jats:bold>v.); <jats:italic>Z. hemiptera</jats:italic> (Thomson, 1858) (= <jats:italic>P. hemiptera</jats:italic> (Thomson, 1858), <jats:bold>comb. nov.</jats:bold>); <jats:italic>Z. microtoma</jats:italic> (Kieffer, 1909) (= <jats:italic>P. microtoma</jats:italic> (Kieffer, 1909), <jats:bold>comb. nov</jats:bold>.); <jats:italic>Z. soluta</jats:italic> (Kieffer, 1907) (= <jats:italic>P. soluta</jats:italic> (Kieffer, 1907), <jats:bold>comb. nov</jats:bold>.); <jats:italic>Z. striata</jats:italic> (Kieffer, 1909) (= <jats:italic>P. striata</jats:italic> (Kieffer, 1909), <jats:bold>comb. nov</jats:bold>.); <jats:italic>Z. subaptera</jats:italic> (Thomson, 1858) (= <jats:italic>P. subaptera</jats:italic> (Thomson, 1858), <jats:bold>comb. nov</jats:bold>.); <jats:italic>Z. sulciventris</jats:italic> (Kieffer, 1909) (= <jats:italic>P. sulciventris</jats:italic> (Kieffer, 1909), <jats:bold>comb. nov.</jats:bold>), and <jats:italic>Z. unicolor</jats:italic> (Kieffer, 1908) (= <jats:italic>P. unicolor</jats:italic> (Kieffer, 1908), <jats:bold>comb. nov.</jats:bold>).</jats:p>
title: A review of the genus Zygota (Hymenoptera, Diapriidae) in Germany with taxonomic notes on this genus and its distinction from Pantoclis
